Sequence Information.Source: AI predicted, bacteria; bacteriocin, prokaryotes, plant-attached rumen microbiome, plant microbiota

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the unmodified sequence of this peptide shows 41.7% similarity tocathelicidin Saha-CATH5.Activity: Active against bacteria S. aureus MRSA (MIC 32-256 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 64-128 ug/ml), A. baumannii 14 clinical strains (MIC 4-16 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (32-256 ug/ml), C.coli (MIC>128 ug/ml), C. jejuni (32 ug/ml) or >128, E. coli K12 (MIC 64 ug/ml), S. typhimurium (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. faecalis (MIC 32 ug/ml) and L. monocytogenes (MIC 32 ug/ml). Also inhibited biofilm formation:bacteria and disrupted to some extent 48-h preformed biofilms.Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:A. baumannii (150 mM), CaCl2-sensitive:A. baumannii (2.5 mM), MgCl2-insensitive:A. baumannii (1 mM), KCl-insensitive:A. baumannii (4.5 mM),  NH4Cl-insensitive:A. baumannii (6 uM), ZnCl2-insensitive:A. baumannii (8 uM), and FeCl3-insensitive:A. baumannii (4 uM).MOA:bacteria:A. baumannii DSM 30007:: at 4xMIC showed weak membrane permeation.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS (Alexander et al., 2024).Resistance development:yes:bacteria:A. baumannii: A. baumannii DSM 30007 developed some resistance to this peptide in a 28 multiple passage experiment (MIC increased 8 fold).Synergy:antibiotics:    Showed a synergistic effect with gentamicin (FIC 0.25).In vitro toxicity: it showed poor cytotoxicity to multiple cell lines (CC50 >670 ug/ml), including RBC (HC50 >1000 ug/ml).In vivo toxicity: didn't appear to be toxic to Galleria mellonella (90% survied at 8xMIC).Updated 7/2021; 10/2024
Literature Information.Author: Oyama LB, Girdwood SE, Cookson AR, Fernandez-Fuentes N, Priv√© F, Vallin HE, Wilkinson TJ, Golyshin PN, Golyshina OV, Mikut R, Hilpert K, Richards J, Wootton M, Edwards JE, Maresca M, Perrier J, Lundy FT, Luo Y, Zhou M, Hess M, Mantovani HC, Creevey CJ, Huws SA.2017
Literature Information.Title: The rumen microbiome: an underexplored resource for novel antimicrobial discovery
